intro: Claoxylon linostachys subsp. brachyphyllum, commonly known as the short-stemmed claoxylon, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or secondary forest areas. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
